title: Pastor Ng'ang'a hilariously reacts after sacking of all Cabinet Secretaries: "Anguka na wote"
text:
Pastor Ng'ang'a Hilariously Reacts after Sacking of All Cabinet Secretaries: "Anguka na Wote"
- Neno Evangelism founder, Pastor James Maina Ng'ang'a, celebrated President William Ruto's decision to sack all Kenyan cabinet ministers during a national address
- He specifically mentioned Kipchumba Murkomen, the former Minister of Roads, whom he had previously warned about interfering with a servant of God
- The pastor's animosity towards CS Murkomen stems from a March incident where the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission (EACC) sought to reclaim land on Haile Selassie Avenue, where Ng'ang'a's church stands

Neno Evangelism founder, Pastor James Maina Ng'ang'a is celebrating President Ruto's decision to sack all Kenyan cabinet ministers.
The president announced the mega decision on Thursday, July, 11 during a national address.
Prime Cabinet Secretary
Musalia Mudavadi, who also serves as the Cabinet Secretary for Foreign and Diaspora Affairs, was exempted from the purge.
The office of Deputy President
Rigathi Gachagua was also spared.

What did pastor Ng'ang'a say about Sacked cabinet ministers?
During his daily evening services in his church, pastor Ng'ang'a engaged his church members asking what had happened during the day.
"For those who don't speak English please switch off your TV. Today I want to talk in English because my friend, the minister of Roads (Kipchumba Murkomen) has gone home," he said.
Ng'ang'a stated that he had warned the minister about interfering with a servant of God.
"Go, I told you you will go home. I am still coming after you. I swear before God. Even in your grave, you will tell people that God is in heaven."
Ng'ang'a applauded the president for the decision to clean his government.
"Thank you very much Your Excellency for kicking these people( Cabinet Secretaries) out. I wonder if you also chased the MP who criticised our phones," he added.
While engaging his church members, Ng'ang'a laughed after learning that none of the Cabinet Secretary was spared.
"We have hit how many? All of them? Even Kindiki?" Ng'ang'a said laughing out loud.
"If today I met you, I would have bought you(President Ruto) a cup of tea. It's just that I can't find you. Kick them out. Do you remember I have had problems with this government?"
Why is Pastor Ng'ang'a angry with CS Murkomen?
In March,
 the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission (EACC)'s moved to reclaim the land where his church stands along Haile Selassie Avenue.
According to the public watchdog, the prime land was grabbed as it was designated for
Kenya Railways.
The land is among five the commission seeks to reclaim at the intersection of Haile Selassie Avenue and Uhuru Highway.
Pastor Ng'ang'a blasted EACC While talking about the issue, the preacher had no kind words for EACC as he dared them to come after his land.
Source: TUKO.co.ke
